alert.note: Alert for Nye (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 6:17PM PDT until September 03 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Nevada, including the following counties, in central Nevada, Nye. In north central Nevada, Lander. * WHEN...Until 815 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 614 PM PDT, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. -NV SR-722 closed from Lander County border to Austin. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kingston, New Pass Summit, Gillman Springs, Austin, Railroad Pass and Bob Scott Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
